This role specifies scopes to be granted to all mozilla github repositories.

When authorizing a new github organization, you must create a role:
`assume:repo:github.com/<organization>/*` and assign it the scope:
`assume:github:mozilla-repository`.

This way all mozilla repositories will have the scopes granted to this role.

Scopes that apply to everything occuring in this repository - push, cron, actions, etc.
Base scopes for all aws-provisioner-provisioned worker types

This role was auto-generated by pmoore on 28 October 2016 to allow generic worker to access its own config, if its worker type is updated. It queries the provisioner to get the latest worker type definition, to establish if a new deployment is required, by checking the deploymentId field, and seeing if that is different to its current deploymentId. If it is, it will shut down.

Created by garndt

This is to give the worker type additional scopes for creating taskcluster-vcs caches
Needed for generic worker 5.0.0 - this role can be removed when generic worker 5.0.1 is in production!
Needed by generic worker for NSS CI tasks.
Created by pmoore on 9 May 2017

Created by garndt

Additional scopes needed for indexing taskcluster-vcs tasks

queue:create-artifact:* is needed by generic worker (perhaps because it uses, or used, the worker credentials to upload artifacts??)

Windows workerTypes have `aws-provisioner:view-worker-type` to allow generic worker to access its own config, if its worker type is updated. It queries the provisioner to get the latest worker type definition, to establish if a new deployment is required, by checking the deploymentId field, and seeing if that is different to its current deploymentId. If it is, it will shut down.

Created for NSS (fkiefer@mozilla.com) for docker packet.net workers for NSS tasks.
Created by pmoore on 11 July 2017.

Created for NSS (fkiefer@mozilla.com) for macOS mac stadium workers for NSS tasks.
Created by pmoore on 11 July 2017.

Worker type for running internal taskcluster CI jobs on macOS 10.12. Created by pmoore on 26 July 2017 for generic-worker and taskcluster-worker CI. This is to replace currently used `provisionerId`: `pmoore-manual`, `workerType`: `mac-os-x`.
Permissions granted to tc-worker running in packet with QEMU engine.

Base scopes for all scl3-puppet provisioned worker types.

Created by pmoore on 25 March 2017 for rollout in scl3 of OS X workers running generic-worker.

Windows workerTypes have `aws-provisioner:view-worker-type` to allow generic worker to access its own config, if its worker type is updated. It queries the provisioner to get the latest worker type definition, to establish if a new deployment is required, by checking the deploymentId field, and seeing if that is different to its current deploymentId. If it is, it will shut down.

Windows workerTypes have `aws-provisioner:view-worker-type` to allow generic worker to access its own config, if its worker type is updated. It queries the provisioner to get the latest worker type definition, to establish if a new deployment is required, by checking the deploymentId field, and seeing if that is different to its current deploymentId. If it is, it will shut down.

If it is, it will shut down.

If it is, it will shut down.
